abstract: Stocks surged in the last nine months of 2009. But the market’s performance in one year can’t predict the next, the data show.
snippet: Stocks surged in the last nine months of 2009. But the market’s performance in one year can’t predict the next, the data show.
lead_paragraph: A stock that builds momentum in one year often carries it over into the next. Might that momentum effect work for the overall stock market?

headline.main: What the Past Can’t Tell Investors
